newsitem.title: USA: U.S. Mid-Atlantic power rises amid nuke output cut.
newsitem.headline: U.S. Mid-Atlantic power rises amid nuke output cut.

text.p: Spot wholesale electricity prices in the U.S. Mid-Atlantic region rose Monday amid reports of reduced output from the Limerick nuclear unit 1, market sources said.
Output at the 1,163 megawatt (MW) nuclear power plant in Pottstown, Pa., was heard reduced by 400-450 MW as technicians were repairing a condenser pump, industry sources said.
They added Limerick 1 was expected to begin toward full power later today, following completion of repairs.
PECO Energy Co, the operator of Limerick, declined to comment on the repair at Limerick 1.
A number of participants downplayed the significance of the reduced production from Limerick 1 because of moderate weather all along the eastern seaboard, especially for Tuesday.
"It's dull, flat load day," a regional trader said.
Tuesday's temperatures in the Mid-Atlantic are expected to peak in the 60's Fahrenheit range.

Peach Bottom 2 nuclear unit in Delta, Pa., also operated by PECO, resumed 100 percent output after being taken off line last Wednesday due to a problem with the oil line to the generator, PECO confirmed.
The return of Peach Bottom 2 would offset the brief power reduction at Limerick 1, market sources said.

In the Pennsylvania-New Jersey-Maryland (PJM) Interconnect pool, firm, peak electricity prices for Tuesday delivery climbed to the $22.50-$23.25 a megawatt hour (MWh), up from Friday's $21.25-$22.00 range for Monday.
Firm, peak PJM power for the rest of the week was quoted at $22.50-$23.50, up sharply from a quote of $20.00-$21.00 on Friday.
PJM electricity for the balance of October was discussed at $22.00-$23.00, wider than Friday's range of $22.50-$23.00.
November PJM prices were assessed at $22.65-$22.75, better bid than Friday's $22.50-$22.75 range.
December PJM power was pegged at $26.75-$27.00, compared with a quote near $26.75.
For the balance of the fourth quarter, PJM electricity was talked at $23.75-$24.00.
First-quarter 1997 PJM was quoted at $28.15-$28.50 while January/February 1997 PJM electricity was assessed at $30.50-$30.65, up slightly from Friday's $30.45-$30.75.
Second-quarter 1997 PJM deliveries were discussed at $21.75-$22.25.
